title: How to Make Pempek Kapal Selam

steps.headline: Boil the black sugar shell in a pot with a liter of water.
steps.description: Heat the sugar until it boils and turns black.

steps.headline: Strain the sugar mixture with strainer to life out any unwanted particles.
Mash the cayenne pepper and garlic together.
steps.description: Mash until a smooth paste is formed.

steps.headline: Mix the mashed cayenne pepper and garlic with the boiled black sugar shell.
Boil and stir the cuko at the same time until it coagulates (thickens).
steps.description: Then place in a bowl for serving. Leave until it is cool enough to be served with the fried pempek and diced cucumbers.

steps.headline: Mix a little salt in a glass of water.
steps.description: Pour the saltwater onto the milled fish in a large bowl.

steps.headline: Stir the milled fish while pouring the saltwater.
steps.description: Add some flavoring as you stir.

steps.headline: Mix the milled fish with the ebi sago until they are mixed thoroughly.
Use some sago to flour your hand.
steps.description: Take a portion of the milled fish mixed with the sago and place it in your palm. Then roll the fish mixture to form a ball.

steps.headline: Make a hole with your index finger in the fish ball.
steps.description: Gently widen the fish ball until it's bigger but be careful not to poke a hole through it.

steps.headline: Pour a whole egg into the hole of the fish ball.
steps.description: Then close it tightly by wrapping the top part of the opened hole and gently squeezing it back into a whole ball.

steps.headline: Repeat the steps until all the milled fish has been used and transformed into the pempek.
steps.description: When all of them have been made, boil them in hot water until they float, then drain them.

steps.headline: Deep fry the pempek with cooking oil.
steps.description: Fry until each ball turns slightly brownish. Use a slotted spoon or similar to retrieve the fried fish balls, then drain. Once this is done, the pempek is ready to serve. Serve it with the cuko (see above) and diced cucumbers.

Then roll the fish mixture to form a ball. Make a hole with your index finger in the fish ball. Gently widen the fish ball until it's bigger but be careful not to poke a hole through it. Once this is done, the pempek is ready to serve. Serve it with the cuko (see above) and diced cucumbers. Finished.
